speaker: Waiter
text: Hey, how're you doing, doc?  The usual?

speaker: Frasier
text: Please.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll have my usual, too.

speaker: Waiter
text: And that would be...?

speaker: Niles
text: Ah!  I come here every day.  You must remember... my usual is... a half-caf... cappuccino... with a light dusting of...

speaker: Waiter
text: Nutmeg.

speaker: Niles
text: Cinnamon! [_the waiter leaves_] God, that's infuriating!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I come in here every bit as often as you do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't take it to heart, Niles.  This person just happened to remember me best, the next person might just as easily...  [_A woman notices Frasier_]

speaker: Woman
text: Oh my God, you're Frasier Crane.  Could I bother you for an autograph?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you can't. [_then:_] It's never a bother. [_laughs_]

speaker: Woman
text: [_as he's signing_] I love your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Woman
text: I just think you're like the smartest guy on the face of the earth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, one does hear tales of a certain wise man in Tibet, but why split hairs?  There you go.

speaker: Woman
text: Thanks.  [_The woman leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Where was I?

speaker: Niles
text: You were last seen hiking up Mount Ego!  [_Martin and Daphne enter arguing_]

speaker: Martin
text: Shut up already!  You've been yakking about this all morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it's a stupid rule and it's always we foreigners that suffer for it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Began driving on the wrong side of the road today, did we?

speaker: Daphne
text: No!  It's about my friend, Xena... oh, you don't want to hear about it.  [_Behind her, Martin signals to them not to ask_]

speaker: Niles
text: Xena, isn't she the Greek one?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, we've been planning a trip together.  You see, her mother's taking a luxury cruise and her ship will be docked in Mazatlan for a week, she invited us down to join her. Only I can't go because my bloody passport's expired.

speaker: Niles
text: Still, don't give up, one way or another we'll get you across that border.  If I have to, I'll snuggle you under an old blanket!

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't you mean smuggle?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm using code language, you can't be too careful!  [_The waiter brings Frasier's coffee_]

speaker: Waiter
text: There you go, Doc.  Anything for you, ma'am?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thanks, I've already ordered.

speaker: Waiter
text: [_notices Niles_] Oh, I'm sorry, you had the...

speaker: Niles
text: Absent-minded waiter, I'll get it myself! [_goes to counter_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Roz called.  She wanted me to remind you about your meeting with the station manager. [_Martin sits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes, that, he probably wants to discuss my one-thousandth radio broadcast that's coming up next week.

speaker: Martin
text: You've done a thousand shows?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and if I know the station manager, he'll want to mark the occasion with some sort of gaudy celebration.  Press parties and God knows what!  No, I don't really kind of go in for that sort of self-congratulatory hoopla!  The work is the thing for me!

speaker: Daphne
text: But still, a thousand shows!  That's quite an achievement.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I suppose, who'd have thought?

speaker: Martin
text: Not me, that's for damn sure.  Yeah, those first two weeks. Peeuw!  Open a window!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, dad!  **ONE SHOW SHORT OF SCHEHERAZADE (SAY IT THREE TIMES FAST)**  [_Scene Two - Radio Station. Bulldog is looking through some slots in the producer's booth as Roz enters_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, morning, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Morning, Bulldog.  [_Roz notices a white teddy bear on the console_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my gosh, look what Frasier got for me.  It's so cute! [_reads card_] "Dear Roz, a huggy bear for the mom to be. Love, Bulldog"?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I guess I should have known you'd think it was from Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm so sorry, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no, it's okay.  I know I'm not the warmest guy in the world, but when it comes to kids I get kinda, well, you know...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh! Bulldog, come here.  Come here.  [_Roz hugs Bulldog. Obviously, Bulldog is enjoying it_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, you're going to make a good mother, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Bulldog, that's sweet.  [_Roz tries to move away but he is attached_]

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog?  [_Bulldog moves closer to her breasts as Roz pushes him away_]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, get off me!  You just wanted to hug me because my breasts are getting bigger.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, I was just trying to get close enough to feel a little kick.  [_Roz then appropriately gives him a kick and he leaves the booth as Frasier enters_]

speaker: Roz
text: Get out!  Pervert!

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Roz.  I got you one of those little muffins that you love. [_hands it over_]

speaker: Roz
text: You're not getting a hug!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I see those mood swings are leveled off nicely.  I'll just run upstairs and have that little meeting with Greg in his office.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, wait, it's been cancelled.  He wanted to talk to you about your thousandth show but I ran into him and I handled it.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, let me have it!  What kind of public circus am I in for?  I suppose a garish outdoor rally like the one they gave for Bob and Nipsy over at KPLK!

speaker: Roz
text: I told him just what you said.  That how the work is its own reward, so you're off the hook.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're not doing anything?

speaker: Roz
text: Nope.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_obviously let down_] Well, well done, Roz.  That's a relief. Although, I'm not sure I'm being fair to you.  You see, I did hear that after that rally, Bob and Nipsy's ratings went up thirty percent.  Their producer got a handsome raise.

speaker: Roz
text: [_at a missed chance_] Oh, yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: And you with the little one coming...

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it's too late now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Can't be helped.  Best to just leave it alone. [_pauses_] Still... for the benefit of the station, what's good for KACL's good for all of us, isn't it?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that's true.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, well, I suppose you could just give Greg a call and tell him I'd be willing, well for your sake and the station's, to submit to a small tasteful, low-key... public rally.  [_Frasier glances innocently at Roz_]  **ONE OF THE WORLD'S FOREMOST EXPERTS ON HAIR PULLING**  [_Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is sat in his chair, as Daphne talks on the phone_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I just want to renew my passport!  No, I'm a resident alien here from England - you know, the country that used to own you people!

speaker: Martin
text: [_aside sarcastic:_] She'll go right to the head of the line now!

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't wait two weeks!  My friend Xena's flying down to meet her mum's ship, Sunday. [_pause_] Don't you put me on hold again!  I'll hang up, I mean it! [_pause and then she hangs up_] I showed him!  [_Frasier enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_acting as though he can't stand the attention but obviously in love with it_] Well, it's official.  My thousandth show is now an event!

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, nothing short of a media circus with you-know-who in the centre ring.  They're planning a promotional blitzkrieg capped off by a public rally in my honour at the foot of the Space Needle!

speaker: Martin
text: Wow!  That's great!  You're going to be thrilled.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course I'm flattered, I'm just a little bit embarrassed, dad.  I'd have been content with a pat on the back and an ice cream cake.  Oh, dad, they've asked if you might say a few words at the rally.  You don't have to, if it makes you nervous.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no problem!  Yeah, I can't tell you how many retirement dinners I've spoken at.  I can just dig out my old joke book; "One Thousand And One Side-Splitters, Rib-Ticklers and Thigh-Slappers".

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure you're a veritable chiropractor at mirth but [_phone rings_] I think what they're looking for is something just a bit more personal.  [_Frasier answers the phone_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello. [_pause_] All right, Roz.  Roz, slow down. [_pause_] Oh, good Lord, the mayor!  Well, has "Frasier" fever swept all the way to city hall?!  Well, all right, Roz, I'll see you tomorrow. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: The mayor's going to be there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  And not just be there, he's going to present me with a key to the city, after which he's going to proclaim it "Frasier Crane Day" in Seattle!

speaker: Martin
text: Way to go, kid!  [_The doorbell sounds_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Who can this be?  The mechanic from the Vatican with my Pope- mobile?!  [_Frasier opens door to Niles.  He has a broad smile and a magazine_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, dinner's on me.  I got some very good news today.

speaker: Daphne
text: What a coincidence!  Your brother just got some good news too!

speaker: Niles
text: Not so good as mine, I suspect.  But first of all, I have to apologise for being so snippy this morning.  I've been feeling a bit eclipsed lately, but all that vanished when I reached my office, and what was waiting on my desk, but a gift from the self-esteem ferry? [_holds magazine up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: "The American Journal of Psychiatry"?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm-mmm, hmm-mmm.  I refer you to the letters page, third one down.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "Dear Sirs, Dr. Egmond Sandeling's recent article on Trichotilimania contains several errors.  He would do well to read the groundbreaking work on the subject published by, among others, Dr. Alan Corville, Dr. Milo Lordestein...

speaker: Niles
text: Skip to the end.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_read_] ...Oh, Dr. Geraldine Fenley and Dr. Niles Crane!

speaker: Niles
text: Not too shabby, eh?

speaker: Frasier
text: And quite an accolade.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I had no idea you were such a well-known expert on... on the thing that the letter mentioned.

speaker: Martin
text: And the way they saved you for last so you really stand out.

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing to kick away the clouds like a heavy sip from the goblet of fame!  Which reminds me, I told Jean-Claude to start my victory Martini shaking at precisely eight o' clock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Off we go, then!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait, you had some news yourself.  Do tell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, let's just wait for that Martini, shall we?  [_Niles and Frasier exit as Frasier gives Martin and Daphne a look of sorrow for Niles_]  **IT'S THE MOST WONDERFUL TIME OF THE YEAR**  [_Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is at the counter as Niles arrives_]

speaker: Niles
text: Happy Frasier Crane Day.  Or is it Merry Frasier Crane Day, I can never remember.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very amusing.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waiter_] I'll have a half-caf cappucino. [_to Frasier_] Sorry I'm late, I stopped half way to listen to a jolly band of Frasier Crane Day carolers!  I tried to join in on "The Twelve Days Of Frasier" but, er, forgot the words around day seven.  How does it go again?

speaker: Frasier
text: I believe it's "seven snobs a' sniping."  Well, you just snipe away.  I take your jealousy as the compliment that it is.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, now, if I indulge in a little affectionate joshing, doesn't mean I'm jealous.  I'm nothing but happy for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, Niles.  You know, I'm just a touch skittish today.  All this fuss over me. [_to waiter_] Say, is it possible to get these two to go? [_waiter complies_]

speaker: Niles
text: To go?  We're not due at the Space Needle for an hour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I thought a walk might do us some good, get a little exercise, then maybe I can stroll away my jitters.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right, I could use the fresh air, I'm feeling a tad sluggish. [_they take their coffees_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, up late last night?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm afraid so, as usual I left it till the last minute to write all my Frasier Crane Day cards!  [_Niles and Frasier exit the caf e_]  [_End of Act One_]  [_Act Two_]  [_Scene One - On Location in Seattle. Frasier and Niles are walking down the street with their coffees_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What a lovely day!  I'm so glad we decided to walk.  I feel calmer already. Man: [_passing by_] Hey, Doc'!  Way to go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, [_waves_] I'm listening. [_Niles shakes his head annoyed_] I just hope Dad doesn't get too nervous about his speech today.  I've been giving him little tips all week.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, really?  As Daphne tells it, you wrote the whole thing for him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I did no such thing!  I added a _bon mot_ or two, tidied up the language, removed any questionable material.

speaker: Niles
text: There's not a word of his left, is there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not a comma! [_waves to others_] I'm listening!

speaker: Niles
text: Here's a tip for you.  The ones with cameras are tourists. They have no idea who you are, much less why you're listening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, don't be so churlish.  The man clearly waved to me first.

speaker: Niles
text: He didn't wave at you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes he did!

speaker: Niles
text: He was probably waving...

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know why you're even objecting...

speaker: Niles
text: He was waving for a cab to get away from the scary listening man!  [_Frasier and Niles carry on arguing as they walk down the street_]  [_Scene Two - Location in Seattle. Farmer's Market.  Niles and Frasier are now walking through the market with their coffee._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I love this place.  Here you can feel the pulse of the city.  You know what I think when I see all these people here rustling about.

speaker: Niles
text: Low turnout over at Frasier Crane Day?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  I think that they're the reason I love this city.  [_Frasier waves to people_]

speaker: Niles
text: Stop waving!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, there's nothing wrong with being friendly.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there is a difference between being friendly and making a public spectacle of yourself.  [_Then they pass the famous fish store, where they throw the fish out to the customer.  A fish nearly hits Niles, he jumps back with a yelp and drops his coffee all over Frasier's shoes_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, did you see that man tried to assault me with a fish!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, Niles, get a grip.  God's sakes, you become hysterical over the littlest things.  Oh, my God!  My suede shoes, you've spilled Latte all over them, they're ruined.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry... and it was a half-caf cappuccino, why can no- one remember that!  [_Scene Three - Location in Seattle. Niles and Frasier are still walking the streets_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll just have to replace them, I'll look foolish otherwise.

speaker: Niles
text: Never in my life have I heard such caterwauling over a pair of shoes.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll have you know, I spent a bundle on these shoes. They're "Joan and Davids."

speaker: Niles
text: You named them?

speaker: Frasier
text: Shut up!  [_Scene Four - Location in Seattle. Niles and Frasier are exiting from a shoe shop named "Lloyd & Keenan" (A sneaky reference to the episode's authors)_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, these are quite handsome.  Even though they are just a bit snug.

speaker: Niles
text: We could always go back.  I think there's a pair in there you didn't try on!

speaker: Frasier
text: We weren't in there that long! [_looks at watch_] My God, the rally's about to start.  Give me your phone, I'll call Roz.  [_Niles hands over the phone_]

speaker: Niles
text: There you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_Frasier dials_]  [_Scene Five - Space Needle. A huge crowd is gathered at the foot of the needle.  Roz is backstage and she answers the phone_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Frasier, do you know what time it is?  Where the hell are you?  We're on the air in two minutes!  [_Scene Six - Location in Seattle_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in phone:_] I'm sorry, I was involved in a small accident. I'm fine!  Just start without me, we'll take a cab! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Niles
text: We'll have better luck at the corner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right. [_they start to go_] Niles, wait.  Too many fans that way, I'll be mobbed.  We'll cut over one block through that alley!  [_They head off_]  [_Scene Seven - Space Needle. Bulldog, Martin, Eddie and Daphne are sat on the front row as Roz approaches them_]

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier's running late so I've got to use you first, okay, Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, oh, yeah, sure, okay. [_Roz leaves_] Jeez, I was hoping for a little more time!  I haven't even looked at this stuff Frasier wrote for me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_on podium_] Good afternoon, everyone and welcome also to our radio listeners.  I'm Roz Doyle and I'd like to thank you all for helping us congratulate Dr. Frasier Crane.  [_They all applaud_]

speaker: Roz
text: We've got the full program for you today and....  [_Meanwhile, Martin and Daphne chat_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Stop worrying.  Dr. Crane's a very good writer.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, look at this, I'm gonna die out there with this crap.

speaker: Roz
text: [_to all:_] Unfortunately, our guest of honour has been detained but we do have the next best thing - his dad, Martin Crane.  [_Martin goes up onto the podeum_]

speaker: Martin
text: Good afternoon. [_obvious reading:_] Twenty-three years ago, my son, Frasier, came to me and asked if I would put him through medical school.  I agreed to pay for it but remarked "I should have my head examined."  Frasier replied, "Give me eight years and I'll do it for you!"  [_This joke fails to get a laugh as Bulldog and Daphne look on in sympathy_]

speaker: Martin
text: It was a hard eight years for Frasier but as someone once quipped, a good psychiatrist never shrinks from a challenge!  [_Everybody moans at this pun, including little Eddie_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez!  [_Scene Eight - Location in Seattle. A back alley.  Frasier is stood dusting himself off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, Niles, will you come outta there?!

speaker: Niles
text: Our mugger specifically instructed us to wait for five minutes!

speaker: Frasier
text: If he wanted us to time it exactly, he wouldn't have taken our watches!

speaker: Niles
text: [_comes out dusting himself_] All right, all right, calm down. I see you're new to this whole mugging thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: I just can't believe I'm missing my own rally.  Come on! These shoes are killing me, they're like the work of a skilled Chinese foot binder!  [_Frasier and Niles are walking as they pass a man playing a saxophone, he is evidently blind and people are throwing money into his case_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, give me your phone, I'll have Roz send us a car!

speaker: Niles
text: My phone?!  What do you think the mugger was reaching into my breast pocket for?  Well, the consolation is that he jabbed himself on my emergency sewing kit.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_notices pay phone_] Niles, a pay phone!

speaker: Niles
text: It's not much use to us unless we can find a quarter.  [_They notice someone throwing money into the artist's case.  They give a knowing glance_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, look.

speaker: Niles
text: You cannot be serious, you want to rob that poor old man?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't take it that serious!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, he's blind.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know!  It's the first break we've had today.  Niles, I'll distract him.  [_Frasier goes to him as Niles slowly lifts a quarter_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good afternoon. [_laughs_] So, sounding lovely.

speaker: Girl
text: Stop, thief!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, run!  [_Niles and Frasier run away followed by a mob of ten year-old girls_]  [_Scene Nine - Space Needle. Bulldog is giving his speech_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'd like to thank Frasier Crane for his friendship.  [_Meanwhile, Daphne is talking to the mayor of Seattle_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Excuse me, Mayor Rice?

speaker: Mayor
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: I have a small bone to pick with you.  I can't say I care for the way your city treats us poor aliens.

speaker: Mayor
text: [_confused_] Er, you're an alien?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, Daphne Moon.  You see, my friend, Xena, and I, she's an alien too, we're trying to get down to Mazatlan to rendezvous with her mother's ship...

speaker: Mayor
text: [_thinking she's mad_] Her mothership?

speaker: Daphne
text: And from what I hear, it's quite spectacular.

speaker: Mayor
text: [_patronising_] I'm sure it is.  Why don't you go with these two gentlemen?  I'm sure they could take care of you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, thank you very much.  [_Two men escort her off the stage_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello. Man: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you two work for the mayor? Man: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I suppose I should know that already - you see, I'm a bit psychic.  [_Scene Ten - Location in Seattle. Frasier and Niles are still walking.  Frasier is complaining about his shoes killing him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't go on any longer.  My feet are killing me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks behind him_] We lost... most of them dropped out after the first quarter.  But that short one with the pigtails was a regular gazelle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. [_looks at Space Needle_] Look!  It's even farther away than it was before.

speaker: Niles
text: [_notices monorail_] The monorail!  It goes to the Space Needle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's go!  [_Scene Eleven - Seattle Monorail. Frasier and Niles sit down_]

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think anyone saw us sneaking on?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I think we're all right.

speaker: Niles
text: I hate to say it but it was sort of exciting flaunting the law like that.  It gives you some idea as to why outlaws have also been such romantic figures.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, perhaps you might have cut a more dashing figure had you vaulted over the turnstile rather than crawling underneath it!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm surprised the trains are even running on Frasier Crane Day!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, with any luck we'll still catch the last twenty minutes of the rally.  But how I'll explain my lateness, I have no idea.  I certainly can't tell them about the fish, the little girls.  I'll have to make something up I suppose, any suggestions?

speaker: Niles
text: The train stopped.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not very original.

speaker: Niles
text: No, Frasier, the train's stopped.  [_It seems the train has come to a halt outside the Space Needle_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord. [_to conductor_] Excuse me, what's happening?

speaker: Conductor
text: There's an electrical problem ahead, we're going back to West Lake.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  But those people are waiting for me, they're so close.

speaker: Conductor
text: I guess it just isn't your day.

speaker: Frasier
text: But it is my day!  [_Niles consoles him_]

speaker: Niles
text: Don't panic.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gets louder_] Don't panic?  Yes, why should I have any reason to panic?  My God, I'm only going to miss a celebration in my honour, I'm going to be a laughingstock forever.  And why? Because you spilt coffee on my shoes!

speaker: Niles
text: You're blaming me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you had the gripping abilities every species above the tree sloth was born with...

speaker: Niles
text: You think of those forty-five minutes you and your ego spent in that shoe store, trying on every pair of shoes - including the ones the manager was wearing!

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you calling me vain?

speaker: Niles
text: If the "Joan & David" fits...  [_They carry on arguing until they notice everyone is looking at them_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't even know why I'm yelling at you.  I guess I'm just trying to blame you because I don't want to face the truth. I'm a big, fat phony.  I wanted my day!  I wanted hoopla and fuss, I practically planned the whole thing myself.

speaker: Niles
text: You did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  It says a lot about me as a psychiatrist, doesn't it? I'm a small man!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, what does it say about me that I was happy seeing you miss your day?

speaker: Frasier
text: You were?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.  I've been jealous of you all week.  I'm a tiny man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Next to me you're a giant!

speaker: Niles
text: I stare up at your ankles!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd need a stepladder just to...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, let's not do this.  You shouldn't feel guilty, Frasier. Everyone deserves a fuss.  You above all.  You've helped a lot of people, they deserve a chance to thank you for it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.  [_Frasier watches out of the window as we hear Roz_]

speaker: Roz
text: Dr. Crane is on his way, he should be here any minute.  [_The train begins to move back_]

speaker: Frasier
text: There it goes.  Good bye, fuss.  Good bye, day!  [_The train leaves the area_]  [_Scene Twelve - Location in Seattle. West Lake Monorail Station.  Niles and Frasier enter the streets_]

speaker: Niles
text: I hesitate to say this, but you still have time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!  Don't you dare get my hopes up!  The ship has sailed, that fat lady has...  [_A taxi passes and they started shouting like hell to no success_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, damn!  I give up.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I don't.  This is your day and if I can get you there for a curtain call, I will.  I still have the blind man's quarter.  Stay here, I'm going to call a cab.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.  Good, run.  [_Niles runs inside as a limousine pulls up_]

speaker: Driver
text: Hey, did I hear you yelling for a cab?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Driver
text: I can take you if you want.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you serious?  Niles!  Niles, let's go!  [_Frasier decides the wait would be futile and gets into the taxi_]  [_Scene Twelve - Taxi. Frasier sits on the backseat_]

speaker: Driver
text: What about your friend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he'll be all right.  He's got street smarts!

speaker: Driver
text: Where are we going?

speaker: Frasier
text: The Space Needle, please.

speaker: Driver
text: No problem, I'll have you there in five minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the first good news I've had all day.

speaker: Driver
text: I've had a bit of a rough day myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh?

speaker: Driver
text: Yeah, my ex-wife is getting remarried in Pennsylvania.  Are you going to that rally over there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, as a matter of fact, I am.

speaker: Driver
text: I told her I'd come to the wedding, but now I've got cold feet.  Better make up my mind soon, the plane leaves in a few hours.  They don't give you any bargains on those last minute tickets, either.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe this isn't the best time to tell you this, but I'll have to owe you for this ride.

speaker: Driver
text: Don't worry about it.  We probably never should have gotten married in the first place.  We were dumb.  Had a few good years, though.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's something at least.

speaker: Driver
text: At least the kids are going to be there tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kids?

speaker: Driver
text: Son and a daughter.  I don't see them much.  They went with their mom after we divorced.  Of course, I think I'm more excited about seeing them than they are about seeing me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why would you say that?

speaker: Driver
text: Just a feeling.  I didn't make much of my life back when Marie and I were together.  I turned it around, though.  I own this car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a nice one.

speaker: Driver
text: The hardest part is, if I do go, I have to see my in-laws. They never were too crazy about me.  This new guy Marie's marrying, he's supposed to be some kinda big success.  I don't know what to say to any of them.  Part of me thinks I'd just be best leaving the whole thing alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: And part of you doesn't?

speaker: Driver
text: I'd like to see my kids.  Especially now they're getting a new dad.  What a choice, eh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, sometimes difficult choices like these can be good things.  They can teach us about who we are.  [_They pull up next to the Space Needle_]

speaker: Driver
text: I bet you hear enough about this.  Besides, we're here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't worry about me, I've got plenty of time.  Tell me more about your kids.

speaker: Driver
text: I'm John, by the way. [_extends his hand_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes it_] I'm Frasier.  [_The camera pulls up from the car as we here "The Saints Go Marching In" and we see a banner on the Space Needle reading "Frasier"_]  [_End of Act Two_]
